images.copyright: Ring-tailed lemurs in Madagascar for World Lemur Day (© Image Source/Alamy)
images.title: The lemurs of Madagascar
images.caption: The lemurs of Madagascar
images.desc: What better place to ring in World Lemur Day than Madagascar? The island, off the coast of southeastern Africa, is the native home to lemurs. Today you'll find over 100 species and subspecies of the critters here. Most are small, with a pointed nose, large eyes, and a tail. They mainly live in trees and can be highly social, like the ring-tailed lemurs on our homepage, or live a solo existence like the elusive aye-aye. Lemurs have opposable thumbs and five fingers with fingernails on each hand, a characteristic that helps secure their spot as a member of the primate order of mammals.
